data.text:
Cole Porter

Profession: Composer and Lyricist

Biography: Porter is best known as a composer and songwriter for Broadway and in films, with his musical 'Kiss Me, Kate' winning the very first Tony Award for Best Musical.

He was notable for writing music and lyrics together, whereas most musicals had separate composers and songwriters.

Other famous musicals include 'Anything Goes,' 'Can-Can,' and 'Silk Stockings.'

Across these works, and those in film, Porter had numerous hit songs; 'I've Got You Under My Skin,' 'Night and Day,' 'From This Moment On,' and countless others.

Born: June 9, 1891

Birthplace: Peru, Indiana, USA

Generation: Lost Generation

Star Sign: Gemini

Died: October 15, 1964 (aged 73)

Married Life

American composer and songwriter Cole Porter (28) weds American socialite Linda Lee Thomas (36), until her death in 1954
